thread.title: Aishwarya Rajesh stars in the tamil remake of Memories
thread.title_full: Aishwarya Rajesh stars in the tamil remake of Memories - The Times of India

author: Janani Karthik
title: Aishwarya Rajesh stars in the tamil remake of Memories
text:
Aishwarya Rajesh has recently joined the cast of the Tamil remake of the Malayalam film Memories. The film has Arulnithi in the lead and Aishwarya Dutta of Tamizhuku En Ondrai Azhuthavum fame as one of the female leads. The team is currently shooting in the city for the film, which is being directed by Arivazhagan of Eeram fame.
A source says, "Aishwarya Rajesh is currently shooting for the film and she is playing the role of Arulnithi's wife. The team is currently canning a wedding sequence in a hall in the city. The other female lead is Aishwarya Dutta, who will also essay an interesting role in this thriller."
Confirming the news Aishwarya says, "Yes, I am paired opposite Arulnithi in this film." The Malayalam film Memories was directed by Jeethu Joseph and the film had Prithviraj, Meghna Raj and Mia George in the lead roles.
Meanwhile, when quizzed about the ongoing tiff between Sarathkumar and Vishal in the upcoming Nadigar Sangam elections, Aishwarya said, "I do not have an idea about the battle. But Vishal is a friend, and it would be nice if he wins."
